Class Quaternion

  • java.lang.Object
    • Quaternion

  • public class Quaternion
extends java.lang.Object
    Quaternions and some operations on them. The objects are immutable, i.e. once created, they can not be altered. All methods that return a Quaternion create a new one.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quaternion(double[] data)
      Construct a new quaternion from a four-element vector.
      Quaternion(double x, double y, double z)
      Construct a new quaternion with W = 0.0
      Quaternion(double w, double x, double y, double z)
      Construct an immutable quaternion

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Quaternion conjugate()
      Returns a new Quaternion which is the conjugate of this
      double[] getVector()
      Return the x, y, x components
      double[] heading()
      Return the heading vector (x, y, z)
      Quaternion multiply(Quaternion q)
      Multiply with another quaternion, return a new one
      Quaternion rotate(Quaternion q)
      Rotate according to the argument q, return a new quaternion

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
